title: Right-to-Know Request – Bodycam and Dashcam Footage – July 11, 2023 Arrest of Lisa Marie Kroeger-Kangas

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Hampshire Right to Know Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to the following records related to the arrest of Lisa Marie Kroeger-Kangas, age 46, of Claremont, on or about Tuesday, July 11, 2023, by the New Hampshire State Police:

All body-worn camera footage from troopers involved in the traffic stop, arrest, and subsequent events on Interstate 93 northbound in Concord, beginning at approximately 11:30 p.m.

All dash camera footage from the State Police cruiser(s) involved in the stop and transport.

Any footage capturing the moment when Ms. Kroeger-Kangas allegedly kicked out the rear passenger-side window of a cruiser while detained, sending glass toward two troopers on scene. Any rear-seat footage of the suspect being transported.

According to public statements, Ms. Kroeger-Kangas was arrested for aggravated DUI, and additional charges—including resisting arrest, disorderly conduct, reckless operation, and criminal mischief—were added after the cruiser window was damaged.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: FOIA Request – Bodycam and Dashcam Footage – Jan. 26, 2025 Arrest of Jaden Jablonowski

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to the following records related to the January 26, 2025 police response and arrest of Jaden Jablonowski, age 18:

All body-worn camera footage from Vernon Police Department officers who responded at approximately 7:13 p.m. to the 100 block of Vernon Avenue for an intoxicated male and engaged with Mr. Jablonowski.

All dash camera footage from the patrol vehicle(s) present at the scene of the initial encounter.

Any bodycam footage recorded during transport to and interaction at Rockville General Hospital, where Mr. Jablonowski reportedly assaulted a healthcare worker while in police custody.

If available, I also request any CAD logs or narrative summaries that would assist in identifying relevant footage.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: FOIA Request – Bodycam and Dashcam Footage – March 2, 2025 Arrest of Pedro Santana

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request – Bodycam and Dashcam Footage – March 2, 2025 Arrest of Pedro Santana
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the following records related to the arrest of Pedro Santana (20, of Barker Street, Hartford) on Sunday, March 2, 2025:

All body-worn camera footage from all Berlin Police Department officers involved in or responding to the traffic stop and subsequent foot pursuit beginning at approximately 8:24 a.m. at the Dunkin’ Donuts parking lot on the Berlin Turnpike.

Dash camera footage from the patrol vehicle(s) of the officer(s) who initiated the stop or participated in the arrest.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News
